headline: Speeding driver jailed over death of nine-year-old Halifax girl

annotations.paragraph: A speeding driver who killed a nine-year-old girl after failing to stop at a red light has been jailed.
annotations.reason: Introduces the main event of the article.

annotations.paragraph: Qadeer Hussain was travelling at nearly 20mph above the 30mph speed limit when he hit Alice Williams with his Vauxhall Corsa as she used a pedestrian crossing in Halifax in July 2023.
annotations.reason: Provides specific details about the incident.

annotations.paragraph: Hussain, 55, of Essex Street, Halifax, pleaded guilty to causing death by dangerous driving in February and was sentenced to eight years and five months in prison earlier at Bradford Crown Court.
annotations.reason: Gives information about the legal proceedings and sentence.

annotations.paragraph: A West Yorkshire Police spokesperson said: "Today's sentence will not bring Alice back to her family, but I hope it provides a level of closure that Hussain has been prosecuted for his actions."
annotations.reason: Includes a quote from the police providing context on the impact of the sentence.

annotations.paragraph: Hussain was also disqualified from driving for 10 years and two months.
annotations.reason: Adds additional legal consequences for Hussain.

annotations.paragraph: Alice was struck on King Cross Street as she was walking home from the dentist with her mother and younger brother.
annotations.reason: Provides essential context about the incident location and circumstances.

annotations.paragraph: Prosecutor James Lake said Hussain "made a deliberate decision to run the red light at high speed in the belief that nobody was crossing the road".
annotations.reason: Offers direct commentary on the driver's actions and mindset.

annotations.paragraph: Alice suffered a "catastrophic" brain injury from which doctors said she would never recover and she died two days later.
annotations.reason: Details the severity of the injuries and the outcome, which is central to the story.

annotations.paragraph: The court heard that Hussain initially claimed he was only travelling at up to 30mph and that Alice ran towards his car.

annotations.paragraph: Officers later found he was driving at 49mph and the lights had been red for seven seconds.
annotations.reason: Provides factual evidence contradicting the driver's claims.
